intro: Lantana sellowiana, commonly known as the Brazilian lantana, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its clusters of small, showy flowers that range in color from yellow to orange and red. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a hairy texture. Lantana sellowiana is adapted to a variety of soil types and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions.
